bayou.async

Class FiberLocal<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • bayou.async.FiberLocal<T>

  • public class FiberLocal<T>
extends Object
    A fiber-local variable. This class is an analogue of `ThreadLocal`.

    Example usage: 

         static final FiberLocal<User> fiberLocalUser = new FiberLocal<>();

     Async<Void> action1()
     {
         fiberLocalUser.set(user);
         return Fiber.sleep(Duration.ofSeconds(1))
             .then( v->action2() );
     }
     Async<Void> action2()
     {
         User user = fiberLocalUser.get();
         ...
     }

    The initial fiber-local value of a FiberLocal is always null.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      FiberLocal()
      Create a FiberLocal variable.

    • Constructor Detail

      • FiberLocal

        public FiberLocal()
        Create a FiberLocal variable. The result object is usually assigned to a static final variable.

    • Method Detail

      • get

        public T get()
      throws IllegalStateException
        Get the fiber-local value for this variable.

        The initial fiber-local value, before any set() calls, is null.

        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if `Fiber.current()==null`

      • set

        public void set(T value)
         throws IllegalStateException
        Set the fiber-local value for this variable.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if `Fiber.current()==null`
